<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INVESTING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/25/gamestop-and-amc-one-year-after-meme-stock-mania?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Meme stocks: Where are they now?
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/25/gamestop-and-amc-one-year-after-meme-stock-mania?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="GameStop store overgrown with weeds " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/08ed7829cd0000d7fc0ec83f7446610f0f699951-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One year ago today, shares of a struggling video game retailer by the name of GameStop <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/26/gamestop-shares-are-jumping-again-but-short-sellers-arent-backing-down.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shot up 90%</a>, and another 60% in extended trading. It marked the onset of “meme stock mania,” a period of a few weeks where individual investors piled into stocks that had been written off or heavily shorted by professional investors.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some observers predicted that, with the rise of meme culture on social media, increased access to the stock market through no-fee platforms like Robinhood, and greater animosity toward the Wall Street “suits,” the world of investing would be forever changed.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The reality?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Maybe not. January 26, 2022, finds legendary meme stocks like GameStop and AMC looking more like MJ on the Wizards. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Along with most other companies, GameStop and AMC shares have taken a beating in 2022, and both are down at least 35% year-to-date (though their share prices remain well above their pre-meme stock days).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And despite a few crypto-related stunts that attempted to leverage their godlike status among individual traders, both meme stock darlings have had to confront real-world problems. AMC, for instance, is reportedly looking to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/amc-in-advanced-talks-to-refinance-debt-as-meme-stock-luster-fades-11643121676?mod=lead_feature_below_a_pos1" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">refinance</a> its high-interest debt with box office levels well below pre-pandemic times.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Enthusiasm over meme stocks more broadly appears to be dwindling.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A number of financial products were introduced last year to track meme-friendly stocks, such as the FOMO ETF. But the only thing that ETF is missing out on is…actual meme stocks. Its <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-01-25/meme-stock-etf-is-now-so-dull-manager-says-it-puts-me-to-sleep?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">largest holding</a> currently is energy giant Chevron, and 40% of the fund is in cash, Bloomberg reports. According to its own manager, the current strategy “puts me to sleep.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Meanwhile, on the social media forum that started the craze—Reddit’s WallStreetBets—power users have <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/reddits-wallstreetbets-was-the-gamestop-kingmaker-but-longtime-users-say-the-thrill-is-gone-11643025602?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">moved on</a> to other stock forums and some complain that constructive feedback has been replaced by “cheerleading,” per the WSJ. Last November, the average number of comments on the main WSB page hit ~27,000, down from 47,000 the previous November.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Perhaps retail traders will once again band together to resurrect a zombie company. But <em>probably</em> not while the market is flirting with a correction.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Further reading: </strong>Matt Levine wonders whether the <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2022-01-24/maybe-the-memes-are-over?sref=E9Urfma4" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">memes are over</a>.</p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SEMICONDUCTORS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/chip-shortage-5-day-supply-semiconductors?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Low on chips, high on alarm
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like a restaurant’s homemade ketchup, the global chip shortage is still on the table this year—even though everyone hates it. US companies have less than a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/25/business/economy/chips-semiconductors-shortage.html?partner=slack&smid=sl-share" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">five-day supply</a> of semiconductors, according to a Commerce Department report published Tuesday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s an “alarming” shortage, according to Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo, who also said that at these levels, any production snags could destabilize supply chains. For context, pre-pandemic chip inventories were closer to average pantry mac & cheese levels: sitting at around 40 days.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It was on the AP exam:</strong> The Commerce Department report, based on a survey of more than 150 companies that make and buy chips, found that while demand for semiconductors jumped 17% from 2019 to 2021, there was no proportionate increase in supply. The shortage has juiced up the price of cars, stoked inflation in other sectors, and made acquiring a PS5 a resume-addition-worthy skill.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s the solution? </strong>Raimondo urged Congress to pass legislation that would bolster American semiconductor production. One such bill, which would give $52 billion in subsidies to semiconductor makers who build factories in the US, passed in the Senate in June but has stalled in the House.—<em>MK</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>PS: For more analysis on the chip shortage and other tech industry updates, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=inline&utm_campaign=link&email={email}&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">subscribe to Emerging Tech Brew</a>.</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID-19
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/covid-omicron-vaccine-pfizer-biontech?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Omicron gets its own vaccine
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/covid-omicron-vaccine-pfizer-biontech?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Vaccine dartboard" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/c6e721b04a650daa6d0467c99700f6f86ac33a01-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Pfizer and BioNTech started clinical trials for an Omicron-specific vaccine yesterday. The results will help the pharma partners decide whether to replace their current jab formula with one that targets the most dominant Covid variant.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The new vaccine is </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/pfizer-biontech-launch-trial-omicron-targeted-covid-vaccine-2022-01-25/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">being tested</a></span><span> both as a three-shot series for unvaccinated participants and as a booster for the already vaccinated.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The study’s success won’t just be evaluated on whether it produces antibodies that can beat back Omicron specifically, but also if those antibodies can fight off a wide range of variant riffraff. In that case, you wouldn’t need to get jabbed with a new vaccine for future variants like getting a new Xbox to play the latest <em>Halo</em>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> The current vaccine regimen has largely <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/covid-19-deaths-top-2-100-a-day-highest-in-nearly-a-year-11643135898?mod=hp_lead_pos2" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">been effective</a> at preventing severe Omicron outcomes, so it’s not clear yet whether an O-specific shot is needed. But what the variant lacks in virulence, it makes up for in volume. On Monday, the seven-day average for Covid-19 deaths reached over 2,100 per day in the US, the highest in nearly a year. Epidemiologists warn that number likely hasn’t hit its peak.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/25/key-performance-indicators?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">

<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/25/key-performance-indicators?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">

<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Meghan Markle and Prince Harry signed a $25 million podcast deal with Spotify…but didn’t produce a single piece of content in 2021. With their only episode thus far being a 35-minute “holiday special” in December 2020, Spotify has <a href="https://www.the-sun.com/news/4530357/spotify-meghan-markle-prince-harry-podcast/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reportedly hired</a> in-house producers to give them a kick in the arse. The couple’s no-show is just one in a <a href="https://podnews.net/article/missing-spotify-shows?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">long list</a> of Spotify podcast announcements that have yet to generate content.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“When it’s grim, be the Grim Reaper.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Kansas City Chiefs head coach Andy Reid <a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/26474103.0/aHR0cHM6Ly9wcm9mb290YmFsbHRhbGsubmJjc3BvcnRzLmNvbS8yMDIyLzAxLzI0L2FuZHktcmVpZC10by1wYXRyaWNrLW1haG9tZXMtd2hlbi1pdHMtZ3JpbS1iZS10aGUtZ3JpbS1yZWFwZXIvP3V0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1tYiZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPW5ld3NsZXR0ZXImdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nX2JyZXc/5f10d6a212c71038741b0759B5a8d253b?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">revealed</a> what he told QB Patrick Mahomes before Mahomes engineered a game-saving drive with 13 seconds left in Sunday’s playoff game. Apparently reaping is popular: That game averaged <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2022/01/25/media/nfl-games-viewership-ratings/index.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">43 million viewers</a>, making it the most watched TV broadcast since last year’s Super Bowl. And at one point, 90% of all TVs in the Kansas City area were watching the game.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Cult classic <em>Fight Club </em>gets a very different ending in China. (<a href="https://www.vice.com/en/article/k7wgea/fight-club-alternate-ending-china-censorship?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vice</a>)</p>
</div>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/25/beijing-olympics-first-100-snow-is-human-made?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
China's faking it
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/25/beijing-olympics-first-100-snow-is-human-made?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="View of the alpine ski track in Yanqing on January 14, 2022, ahead of the 2022 Beijing Winter Olympic Games" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/0885e6ad9414dbb1a3d39916b9952bac160d995e-1024x681.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Francois-Xavier Marit/AFP via Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The upcoming Winter Olympics in Beijing will be the first to <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2022-01-22/beijing-winter-olympics-first-to-rely-on-artificial-snow?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rely completely</a> on artificial snow for its ski and snowboard slopes. Why? Well, it never really <em>snows</em> in Yanqing and Zhangjiakou, the two sites set to host the events.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So China is going full <em>MacGruber</em>, using up to 2 million cubic meters of water (which could fill 800 Olympic-sized swimming pools) to create fake snow and provide athletes with optimal shredding conditions.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You might be thinking, “maybe this isn’t the <em>best </em>place to host alpine sports,” but turns out you don’t necessarily need to be subject to the lake effect to host the Winter Olympics. The snow was ~80% artificial at the Sochi Olympics in 2014 and more than 90% fake at PyeongChang four years later.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But fake snow can have real problems. Remember all that water that goes into making it? It’s putting added strain on water supplies in an already arid region. In fact, nearly 10% of water consumed in one district of Zhangjiakou will be diverted to make the fake snow.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>The massive investment in artificial snow is part of China’s long-running (and controversial) attempts to <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/sports/olympics/2022/01/24/olympics-china-weather-control/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">modify the weather</a>, which include bombarding clouds with rockets and shells to induce rain.</p>
</div>

href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/25/gamestop-and-amc-one-year-after-meme-stock-mania?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nMeme stocks: Where are they now? \n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"GameStop store overgrown with weeds \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/08ed7829cd0000d7fc0ec83f7446610f0f699951-1500x1000.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne year ago today, shares of a struggling video game retailer by the name of GameStop \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/26/gamestop-shares-are-jumping-again-but-short-sellers-arent-backing-down.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshot up 90%\u003c/a\u003e, and another 60% in extended trading. It marked the onset of “meme stock mania,” a period of a few weeks where individual investors piled into stocks that had been written off or heavily shorted by professional investors.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome observers predicted that, with the rise of meme culture on social media, increased access to the stock market through no-fee platforms like Robinhood, and greater animosity toward the Wall Street “suits,” the world of investing would be forever changed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe reality?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMaybe not. January 26, 2022, finds legendary meme stocks like GameStop and AMC looking more like MJ on the Wizards. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAlong with most other companies, GameStop and AMC shares have taken a beating in 2022, and both are down at least 35% year-to-date (though their share prices remain well above their pre-meme stock days).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd despite a few crypto-related stunts that attempted to leverage their godlike status among individual traders, both meme stock darlings have had to confront real-world problems. AMC, for instance, is reportedly looking to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/amc-in-advanced-talks-to-refinance-debt-as-meme-stock-luster-fades-11643121676?mod=lead_feature_below_a_pos1\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erefinance\u003c/a\u003e its high-interest debt with box office levels well below pre-pandemic times.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eEnthusiasm over meme stocks more broadly appears to be dwindling.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA number of financial products were introduced last year to track meme-friendly stocks, such as the FOMO ETF. But the only thing that ETF is missing out on is…actual meme stocks. Its \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-01-25/meme-stock-etf-is-now-so-dull-manager-says-it-puts-me-to-sleep?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elargest holding\u003c/a\u003e currently is energy giant Chevron, and 40% of the fund is in cash, Bloomberg reports. According to its own manager, the current strategy “puts me to sleep.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMeanwhile, on the social media forum that started the craze—Reddit’s WallStreetBets—power users have \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/reddits-wallstreetbets-was-the-gamestop-kingmaker-but-longtime-users-say-the-thrill-is-gone-11643025602?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emoved on\u003c/a\u003e to other stock forums and some complain that constructive feedback has been replaced by “cheerleading,” per the WSJ. Last November, the average number of comments on the main WSB page hit ~27,000, down from 47,000 the previous November.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003ePerhaps retail traders will once again band together to resurrect a zombie company. But \u003cem\u003eprobably\u003c/em\u003e not while the market is flirting with a correction.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Further reading: \u003c/strong\u003eMatt Levine wonders whether the \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2022-01-24/maybe-the-memes-are-over?sref=E9Urfma4\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ememes are over\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nLow on chips, high on alarm\n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLike a restaurant’s homemade ketchup, the global chip shortage is still on the table this year—even though everyone hates it. US companies have less than a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/25/business/economy/chips-semiconductors-shortage.html?partner=slack\u0026smid=sl-share\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efive-day supply\u003c/a\u003e of semiconductors, according to a Commerce Department report published Tuesday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat’s an “alarming” shortage, according to Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo, who also said that at these levels, any production snags could destabilize supply chains. For context, pre-pandemic chip inventories were closer to average pantry mac \u0026 cheese levels: sitting at around 40 days.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt was on the AP exam:\u003c/strong\u003e The Commerce Department report, based on a survey of more than 150 companies that make and buy chips, found that while demand for semiconductors jumped 17% from 2019 to 2021, there was no proportionate increase in supply. The shortage has juiced up the price of cars, stoked inflation in other sectors, and made acquiring a PS5 a resume-addition-worthy skill.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s the solution? \u003c/strong\u003eRaimondo urged Congress to pass legislation that would bolster American semiconductor production. One such bill, which would give $52 billion in subsidies to semiconductor makers who build factories in the US, passed in the Senate in June but has stalled in the House.—\u003cem\u003eMK\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003ePS: For more analysis on the chip shortage and other tech collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePfizer and BioNTech started clinical trials for an Omicron-specific vaccine yesterday. The results will help the pharma partners decide whether to replace their current jab formula with one that targets the most dominant Covid variant.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe new vaccine is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/pfizer-biontech-launch-trial-omicron-targeted-covid-vaccine-2022-01-25/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeing tested\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e both as a three-shot series for unvaccinated participants and as a booster for the already vaccinated.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe study’s success won’t just be evaluated on whether it produces antibodies that can beat back Omicron specifically, but also if those antibodies can fight off a wide range of variant riffraff. In that case, you wouldn’t need to get jabbed with a new vaccine for future variants like getting a new Xbox to play the latest \u003cem\u003eHalo\u003c/em\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e The current vaccine regimen has largely \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/covid-19-deaths-top-2-100-a-day-highest-in-nearly-a-year-11643135898?mod=hp_lead_pos2\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeen effective\u003c/a\u003e at preventing severe Omicron outcomes, so it’s not clear yet whether an O-specific shot is needed. But what the variant lacks in virulence, it makes up for in volume. On Monday, the seven-day average for Covid-19 deaths reached over 2,100 per day in the US, the highest in nearly a year. Epidemiologists warn that number likely hasn’t hit its peak.\u003cem\u003e—JW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"View of the alpine ski track in Yanqing on January 14, 2022, ahead of the 2022 Beijing Winter Olympic Games\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancois-Xavier Marit/AFP via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe upcoming Winter Olympics in Beijing will be the first to \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2022-01-22/beijing-winter-olympics-first-to-rely-on-artificial-snow?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erely completely\u003c/a\u003e on artificial snow for its ski and snowboard slopes. Why? Well, it never really \u003cem\u003esnows\u003c/em\u003e in Yanqing and Zhangjiakou, the two sites set to host the events.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo China is going full \u003cem\u003eMacGruber\u003c/em\u003e, using up to 2 million cubic meters of water (which could fill 800 Olympic-sized swimming pools) to create fake snow and provide athletes with optimal shredding conditions.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou might be thinking, “maybe this isn’t the \u003cem\u003ebest \u003c/em\u003eplace to host alpine sports,” but turns out you don’t necessarily need to be subject to the lake effect to host the Winter Olympics. The snow was ~80% artificial at the Sochi Olympics in 2014 and more than 90% fake at PyeongChang four years later.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut fake snow can have real problems. Remember all that water that goes into making it? It’s putting added strain on water supplies in an already arid region. In fact, nearly 10% of water consumed in one district of Zhangjiakou will be diverted to make the fake snow.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThe massive investment in artificial snow is part of China’s long-running (and controversial) attempts to \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/sports/olympics/2022/01/24/olympics-china-weather-control/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emodify the weather\u003c/a\u003e, which include bombarding clouds with rockets and shells to induce rain.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:
